title: Nigeria's central bank loosens rules for banks facilitating crypto transactions
description:
The guidelines aim to set minimum standards and requirements for banking relationships and account openings for virtual asset service providers in Nigeria.

The Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) has rlifted restrictions on banks facilitating cryptocurrency transactions, nearly two years after imposing a total ban on banks dealing with digital currencies.

In a circular sent to banks on December 22, the CBN recognized that the increasing global demand and adoption of cryptocurrency make it unjustifiable to maintain the stringent restrictions imposed on financial institutions in 2021.

The statement noted:

title: Ripple Registered With Central Bank of Ireland
description: Ripple is now registered as a virtual asset service provider with the Central Bank of Ireland. The company explained that it will “seek to provide services to clients across the European Economic Area once the Markets in Crypto Assets Regulation (MiCA) comes into force at the end of 2024, subject to the acquisition of other […]
